poem:
### Damascus Unfurled

In Damascus streets,  
under sun's gentle eye—  
children's laughter mingles  
with prayers unbound.  
Dust unsettles as hope,  
newly awoken,  
dances upon earth's  
warmed skin.  
Arms once heavy  
are lightened  
by dreams silhouetted  
against the morning sky,  
where silence breaks  
and the air breathes  
unfurling freedom.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Thousands of Syrians celebrate fall of Assad in Damascus; Blinken makes surprise Iraq visit for talks – live 5.58pm GMT Summary Here’s a wrap-up of the day’s key events: Thousands of Syrians have taken to the streets in celebration following the ouster of Bashar al-Assad. On Friday, Agence-France Presse reported that families with children, as well as armed and uniformed Islamist fighters gathered in celebration of the first Friday prayers in Damascus following Assad’s overthrow.". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Thousands of Syrians celebrate fall of Assad in Damascus; Blinken makes surprise Iraq visit for talks – live 5.58pm GMT Summary Here’s a wrap-up of the day’s key events: Thousands of Syrians have taken to the streets in celebration following the ouster of Bashar al-Assad. On Friday, Agence-France Presse reported that families with children, as well as armed and uniformed Islamist fighters gathered in celebration of the first Friday prayers in Damascus following Assad’s overthrow.
